image.altText: Four packs of off-brand cigarettes sitting next to a red lighter on an outdoor green metal table.

props.synopsis: Doctors say smoking rates are at levels they haven't seen in a decade due to easy access to illegal cigarettes that are a "quarter of the price" of legal cigarettes.

title.children: Concerns 'off-brand' cigarettes easy to access and cheaper

image.altText: A small white capsule tablet sits in between rulers measuring its size, which have "CanTEST" written on them.

props.synopsis: The capsuled white powder was presented to the pill-testing site on Friday and, when chemists there couldn't make an identification, transferred to the Australian National University for analysis.

title.children: Rare nitazene found in Canberra believed to be Australian first

image.altText: ACT Magistrate Court

props.synopsis: Three alleged kidnappers were trying to recover a $200,000 debt from a 52-year-old man in Monash on September 21, a court has heard, while rejecting their bail application.

title.children: Alleged kidnappers trying to recover $200,000, court hears

image.altText: Brown Header

props.synopsis: Eight days into her new role as interim vice-chancellor at the Australian National University, Rebekah Brown sat down for an exclusive interview to share her plan for getting the institution back on track.

title.children: How the ANU's interim leader wants to turn its reputation around

image.altText: Southwell Park sports field

props.synopsis: Two men have been charged with assault after an alleged coward punch attack during a junior rugby sevens grand final on Sunday in which a referee was knocked unconscious.

title.children: Junior rugby referee hospitalised after alleged assault at under-14s game

image.altText: Blood pressure check

props.synopsis: The federal government says $10.5 million is being invested as "seed funding" to establish three new bulk billing clinics in Canberra, but the Australian Medical Association says it's not clear if this will resolve the issues facing the ACT long-term.

title.children: Will this funding promise help GP access in the ACT?

image.altText: Generic Drone of Homes

props.synopsis: The ACT government has passed legislation enshrining housing as a human right. What does that mean, and should other states follow?

title.children: Making housing a human right might not be the sole key to success

image.altText: Donald Trump and Robert F Kennedy Jr sits by each other with mics in front of them.

props.synopsis: Australia's medicines regulator says paracetamol remains safe to use during pregnancy despite Donald Trump's administration linking its use to an increased risk of autism.

title.children: Experts, TGA reject Trump statement autism is linked to paracetamol

image.altText: A stack of pills on a table

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's advice that pregnant women should limit the use of paracetamol in pregnancy has been criticised as "baseless". So what does it mean for you?

title.children: Why Australian experts say Trump's autism claims are 'baseless'

image.altText: Hannah Thomas with eye patch in black hoodie

props.synopsis: Hannah Thomas was among a group of pro-Palestinian protesters who demonstrated outside a manufacturing facility in June when she sustained a serious eye injury during her arrest for failing to comply with a move on direction.

title.children: NSW Police officer charged with assault over arrest of former Greens candidate

image.altText: Jimmy Kimmel with hands out, wearing a suit and bow tie, standing on stage, brown background

props.synopsis: US comedian Jimmy Kimmel's late-night show will be reinstated after being taken off air, following remarks he made referencing right-wing activist Charlie Kirk.

title.children: Jimmy Kimmel to go back on air after Charlie Kirk comments

image.altText: A woman sits with her head down

props.synopsis: Hakyung Lee admitted to giving her two children an overdose of prescription medicine before changing her name and leaving New Zealand.

title.children: Mother found guilty of murdering two children found in suitcases

image.altText: Sarah, the Duchess of York, walking out wearing a white and black blazer, waving at the crowd with a black glove on her hand.

props.synopsis: The decisions come after British media reported that the Duchess had described the disgraced financier as a "steadfast, generous and supreme friend" in a 2011 letter.

title.children: Multiple charities cut ties with Duchess of York over email to Epstein

image.altText: Signage at an Optus store in Melbourne

props.synopsis: The actions by Optus management in the hours following a series of failed attempts by its customers to call triple-0 raises questions about the telco's fitness to operate in Australia.

title.children: Australians lay dead as investors of Optus's parent company bought shares

image.altText: A man sits at a desk.

props.synopsis: The Australian Securities and Investments Commission took Dave Hodgson and two of his companies to the Federal Court, alleging they were operating without the required financial services licence, and had made misrepresentations to investors.

title.children: Judge finds businessman had 'magic pudding' approach to valuing company

image.altText: A composite image of two boys, one in a white shirt and one in a collared shirt and dark puffer jacket.

props.synopsis: Police charge a 15-year-old boy with the murder of Dau Akueng, also 15, who was found with fatal injuries alongside his 12-year-old friend Chol Achiek in Melbourne's outer west earlier this month.

title.children: Eighth murder charge laid following boys' stabbing deaths

image.altText: A young man in a button-up shirt, walking out of court while holding a piece of paper.

props.synopsis: The case of hit-and-run driver Jake Danby has brought renewed focus to the NT's legal system and the problems it faces. But will changing sentencing laws help?

title.children: Fatal hit-and-run brings NT's sentencing laws into spotlight for review

image.altText: Black and white photo of two people smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: A South Australian kitchen manufacturer says a scammer has tried to extort money to remove several fake one-star reviews posted to Google.

title.children: SA business asked to pay $US200 to remove fake one-star Google reviews

image.altText: Rodrigo Duterte' in a white jacket, with red stripes, smiles, looking sideways, face reflected in a glass pane behind.

props.synopsis: Former president of the Philippines, Rodrigo Duterte, is accused of being involved in the murder of dozens of people.

title.children: ICC charges Philippines former leader with crimes against humanity

image.altText: Camp site with police tape surrounding

props.synopsis: Jaye Lee Walton, 42, has been charged with the manslaughter of his seven-month-old son Reef Hunter Walton in July.

title.children: Father charged with manslaughter of baby during camping trip granted bail

image.altText: Brisbane Lions player Lachie Neale grimaces as he kicks the football with his right foot during a training drill.

props.synopsis: The 31-year-old dual Brownlow medallist, who has been battling a calf injury, took part in training drills in front of 2,000 Brisbane fans at the team's Springfield home.

title.children: Lachie Neale trains as Lions' grand final return gathers pace

image.altText: a satellite map with several red markers indicating where a noise has been heard

props.synopsis: One sleepless resident said he drove around his local area to find the source of the disturbance.

title.children: 'They can't sleep': Humming sound keeping Sydney residents awake

image.altText: Nasiah Wanganeen-Milera reacts after being denied three votes

props.synopsis: It is not often that the AFL's night of nights gets hijacked by a moment not involving the winner of the Brownlow Medal. This is exactly what took place when Nasiah Wanganeen-Milera was seemingly robbed in broad daylight.

title.children: The Nasiah moment that showed the AFL has a serious Brownlow Medal problem

image.altText: A happy woman with grey hair embraces her smiling son with an excited crowd looking on.

props.synopsis: Pro-democracy activist Alaa Abd el-Fattah has been released from prison, following a pardon from the Egyptian president.

title.children: Egyptian activist who helped Peter Greste released from jail

image.altText: Man ponts hand out while sat at desk in hearing

props.synopsis: The CEO of Affinity Education Group appears at a state parliamentary inquiry into the sector.

title.children: CEO quizzed over bonuses after increase in childcare centre breaches

image.altText: A woman floating peacefully in the ocean.

props.synopsis: Marketing researchers hail the controversy of the "Sunshine sickie" tourism campaign as clever in encouraging people to book a beach holiday to combat burnout.

title.children: Workers 'chuck a sickie' for holiday won in 'clever' tourism campaign

image.altText: Workers attempt to fix a broken down train near Strathfield

props.synopsis: An independent review into how a live cable came down on top of a Sydney train in May found the overhead wire that failed had been identified as a risk in 2020 but was never repaired.

title.children: 'Not up to scratch': Scathing review reveals Sydney trains' maintenance woes

image.altText: a woman standing in front of a christmas tree in a white dress

props.synopsis: A Brisbane bus driver charged over a fatal crash in the CBD last year thought he was pressing the brakes before he mounted a footpath and killed a pedestrian, a court has heard.

title.children: Family becomes upset as CCTV of bus crash that killed teen is played in court

image.altText: A man looks at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: A rally on Wall Street has sent Australian stocks higher, after chipmaker Nvidia says it will invest up to $US100 billion ($152 billion) in OpenAI. But Myer shares have slumped after big write-downs drove a huge loss. Follow live.

title.children: ASX rises as gold miners rally, Myer slumps on large loss

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Indonesia, EU sign major trade deal

image.altText: A message reading "AI artificial intelligence", a keyboard, and robot hands are seen

props.synopsis: From robots to supercomputers, artificial intelligence is set to become an integral part of the Australian economy, with tens of billions in benefits to be gained … but for whom?

title.children: 'Biggest gold rush' with AI set to revolutionise Australian economy

image.altText: Kevin Spacey sits at a table in a blue chequered flannel shirt

props.synopsis: He's a prolific fixture on our screens who's famously six degrees from almost anyone. But Kevin Bacon is also a passionate musician and philanthropist.

title.children: Farming, music and philanthropy — there's more than just six degrees of Kevin Bacon

image.altText: A man with glasses and grey hair gestures in front of a black setting.

props.synopsis: The tech entrepreneur's announcement follows deep cuts from governments around the world, led by the United States.

title.children: Bill Gates pledges $US912 million to AIDS and malaria non-profit as US cuts funding

image.altText: Claire-Mater

props.synopsis: Brisbane women have told the ABC they paid an abortion clinic for their chosen miscarriage care rather than getting it at their large public hospital.

title.children: Qld women denied chosen miscarriage care say it's like something from the US

image.altText: A close up of Roland Bull wearing a brown wide brimmed hat and leaning back against a patterned towel.

props.synopsis: As a doctor who advocates for self-care it took me a surprisingly long time to look after myself. Now I'm trying to be a good example for my patients and other doctors.

title.children: As a doctor, I bang on about self-care — I'm finally taking my own advice
